attributes.action: condemn the pope's comments on condom use in Africa.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On a recent visit to Africa the pope has spoken out against the use of condoms to fight HIV/Aids in Africa.

HIV/Aids was, he argued, "a tragedy that cannot be overcome by money alone, that cannot be overcome through the distribution of condoms, which can even increase the problem".
[BBC News - Wed 18th March 2009]

We urge the Prime Minister to join France's foreign ministry in condemning the pope's comments.  No single measure can reduce the rate of HIV/Aids however condoms have been proven to be successful in preventing the transmission of the virus where abstinence is not always an option.
